data.text:
Overall, Lujo is a stunning hotel with top class facilities.  However, the operational side of things is less than slick, and our trip was ruined by a catalogue of errors that made the experience less than stress-free.  In recent years, we have been fortunate to stay at some of the best hotels in Turkey, including Maxx Royal Belek, Maxx Royal Kemer, Voyage Belek, Regnum, and Hilton Dalaman, so these are my points of comparison.    

Pros

•	The pools are in a league of their own.  They were *properly* heated and never busy.  Even the aquapark water was heated!  The 20m indoor pool was usually deserted and perfect for swimming laps. The service around the Maki pools was fabulous.  

•	Our Joy Advisors (WhatsApp assistants), Valeria and Elmira were incredibly helpful and worked their socks off.  They organised a taxi for us to go to an obscure bird watching location, ordered antihistamines from a pharmacy for us, and tried their best to fix the many problems we encountered during our stay (see below in the ‘cons’ section). 

•	The views over the bay are beautiful, aside from the very ugly neighbouring hotel which does spoil it a little bit!

•	The beach is amazing, with (imported) white sand and very calm water.  The only caveat is that the water gets deep *very quickly* so it’s not great for small children or weak swimmers.  Service was great on the beach also. 

•	The rooms are gorgeous with lovely, comfy beds, a choice of mattress (soft, medium, hard), and a pillow menu.  My only complaint was that the family room was a bit short on storage space for a family of 4, meaning the room was always in a mess, but we made do.  We were very grateful to be upgraded to a family corner suite (following a complaint about a catalogue of problems) which was very comfortable with loads of space to put things.  The view was breath-taking.  Family rooms include a complementary PlayStation loan, which was great for the kids. 

•	The cocktails were excellent.  Choice of San Pellegrino or Perrier water was lovely. 

•	The chocolate bar serves Moet (not just at check-in) but (bizarrely) not chocolate!

•	There are lots of healthy and vegetarian food options.  Food highlights were asparagus carpaccio in the Italian restaurant, falafel in the Turkish restaurant and guacamole in the seafood restaurant.  

•	The hotel’s rescue dogs (particularly Tilki) were a massive hit with our kids.

Cons

•	The food was the biggest problem for us.  It was very hit and miss.  Some of it was great but some was disappointing.  For example, we were served burnt bacon, a very greasy burger, and chips that tasted of old fat.  

•	We also had a lot of problems finding food for our fussy children.  There was almost nothing on the menu that they would eat, so we had to place special orders in advance (for things like chicken goujons, plain bread, plain pasta and rice) for every meal.  This had to be done at least 2 hours in advance.  Although we were grateful to have this option, it meant it was difficult to relax as we were constantly having to plan the kids’ food orders.  However, sometimes the special orders never actually materialised.  It was striking that our youngest child ended up losing weight over the course of the holiday.  The lack of a buffet at Lujo compounded these issues.  

•	The service in the restaurants was also very mixed.  Items we ordered frequently got forgotten and there were at least two dinners where one member of the family never got their main course.  

•	We were grateful to be given a room upgrade part way through the stay due to the problems we’d had with meals.  Unfortunately, my son’s (much loved) inflatable crocodile got left behind by the bellboy during the transfer and then popped by the cleaners.  Our joy advisor did very kindly get him another inflatable to say sorry but he was still very upset by croccy’s ‘murder’. 

•	On another day, the cleaners accidentally took my other son’s (extremely important) cuddly toy away with the laundry.  He was hysterical when he saw that it was missing.  Thank goodness, we managed to retrieve it from the laundry area, but we could all have done without the stress of this mini crisis!  

In sum, I think we were quite unlucky with so many things going wrong. Regardless, I can’t see us returning because our kids hated it!
data.title: Stunning hotel with top class facilities but operational problems

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback on your recent stay at Lujo Hotel Bodrum. 

We deeply appreciate your positive comments regarding our exquisite facilities, the excellence of our pools, the dedicated assistance from our Joy Advisors, the captivating bay views, and the splendid beach featuring imported white sand. We are delighted that you found comfort in our well-appointed rooms, enjoyed the breathtaking views, relished our cocktails, and appreciated the diverse selection of healthy and vegetarian food options. Please allow us to mention that we offer, among other treats, delicious homemade strawberry chocolate at the Chocolate Bar.

Nevertheless, we extend our sincere apologies for any aspects of your holiday experience that fell short of your expectations, particularly the challenges you faced with special orders for your children, the unfortunate incidents involving your son's inflatable crocodile and the accidental laundry mishap with the cuddly toy. Such occurrences do not align with our usual standards, and we are dedicated to implementing corrective measures.

We understand that these issues may have impacted your overall enjoyment, and for that, we extend our heartfelt apologies. It would be an honor to welcome you back in the future, providing an opportunity to showcase the improvements we have implemented and regain your trust.

Best regards,
Lujo Management

data.text:
Amazing property in terms of the physical resort - nice setting, lovely spacious grounds, good beach etc. Did not feel crowded (though we visited in low season). Rooms were nice and large with good linens and toiletries. Very comfortable. 

What could have helped is more upfront communication about the resort from staff at checkin. They prefer to communicate via WhatsApp (with your “Joy Advisor”) but this became tedious as you could never speak to anyone quickly. WhatsApp also used to flog you extras (spa, seaplane, excursions) without asking.

Service was the major downfall. The vast majority of the team seemed totally disinterested. No one said hello. Smiles rare. Often rude. Often untrained. Often English language lacking. Beyond this, I had a few notable service failures and there was no recovery, just an “Oh sorry”. This is why I don’t believe it’s a five star hotel, it’s four. 

Food was variable, ranging from superb to awful (overcooked steak - worst I’ve had ever). Better restaurants incurred a €75-100 surcharge per person, not ideal.
data.title: Pretty good - service let’s it down

data.text: We had an excellent holiday at the Lujo hotel. It feels more like a small village than a hotel, with a variety of restaurants to choose from and several beaches and pool decks. We visited at a quiet time of year, but even at peak times the amount of space means it never felt too busy. The staff were friendly and always keen to help. There were several activities, we took part in a bicycle tour, pilates sessions, and played tennis in one of their two courts. The quality of the food was excellent, the Turkish restaurant Asma particularly good. The Opa restaurant was great for breakfast and had lovely views of the beach. For drinks, the classic cocktails were generally OK but the signature hotel cocktails such as the Newton Jack much better. The swim-up rooms meant you always had somewhere you could go for a swim which was super convenient. We saw two live singers in the evenings at the brilliantly named Pablo Esco Bar, Seran Bilgi and Della Miles, who both performed with six-piece bands and were terrific entertainment. Also worth mentioning the spa, sauna and gym, and the water park with some super fun slides (if you're brave enough, try the Rocket). When you check in, you are added to a WhatsApp group with two joy advisors who answer questions and help with anything you need - ours, Julide and Vlada - were terrific. Getting taxis to visit nearby towns was easy, quick and worthwhile. Our favourite place to hang out in the hotel was probably pier lotus, lots of sun loungers, and a lovely sea breeze to balance out the sun.
data.title: Wonderful and luxurious
